channel.title: GCC on Infinity Architect
channel.description: Recent content in GCC on Infinity Architect

item.title: GCC MISC
item.description: cc1 and cc1plus The output of gcc -v actually shows no invocation of the cpp preprocessor. Instead, cc1/cc1plus is invoked for both pre-processing and compilation of C/C++. My assumption is that those 2 programs fork-exec cpp. GCC Developer Options -print-search-dirs -print-sysroot -print-prog-name 1gcc -print-prog-name=cc1 2/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/10.2.0/cc1 copy Specs String The gcc executable is a driver program, invoking other executables, e.g. cc1, as and collect2 (a wrapper around ld) to do the real job.
